thread.title: James O'Keefe Releases 100 Hours of Audio From Inside CNN's Newsroom
thread.title_full: James O'Keefe Releases 100 Hours of Audio From Inside CNN's Newsroom

author: Sam Dorman
title: James O'Keefe Releases 100 Hours of Audio From Inside CNN's Newsroom
text:
BY: Sam Dorman February 23, 2017 11:02 am 
Project Veritas founder James O'Keefe released transcripts and audio on Thursday of conversations between CNN employees allegedly pushing biased viewpoints. 
CNNLeaks.com , a site created by Project Veritas, claimed an anonymous source within CNN leaked audio of the conversations. The audio reveals CNN employees discussing haphazard reporting of poll numbers, insulting Fox News, and claiming the "primary role of a journalist" is to "aid the afflicted and afflict the comfortable." 
The anonymous source, "Miss X," worked in an Atlanta location for CNN. Veritas posted the following conversations about polls numbers on Supreme Court Justice Sotomayor. 
Miss X: "This wasn't released until two weeks after. So can we say a newly released poll?" 
Joe Sterling: "No, you can't say that. You can't say that at all. This isn't a newly released." 
Miss X: "But it says newly released on Friday." 
Joe Sterling: "I know, how did we write about this? Did we write a wire about this? "I don't think we stand to change how people think of her [Sotomayor]. Geez, I mean if someone picked this up it's not going to change â€“ it's not going to change anybody's opinion." 
See more of the audio from Project Veritas below:
